knimeNode.name: GroupBy
knimeNode.shortDescription: Groups the table by the selected column(s) and aggregates the remaining columns using the selected aggregation method.

fullDescription.intro:
The node groups the row by the selected column(s). The remaining rows are aggregated by the defined method. The user can choose an aggregation method for all none numerical columns and an aggregation method for all numerical columns. In order to save resources and allow the handling of large tables the node sorts the input table by the selected group columns prior calculating the aggregation values.
If the number of unique values per group exeeds the defined number of unique values the calculation of this group is skipped, the aggregation result is a missing value and an appropriate warning is displayed after execution.
If the 'Sort in memory' option is checked the complete table is loaded into the memory to speed up the sorting process.
Aggregation methods available for none numerical and numerical columns:
First: Takes the first value per group.
Last: Takes the last value per group.
Mode: Takes the value with the most occurrences per group. If multiple values match this criterion one of these values is randomly chosen.
Count: Counts members per group.
Aggregation methods only available for numerical columns:
Minimum: Calculates the minimum per group.
Maximum: Calculates the maximum per group.
Mean: Calculates the mean per group.
Sum: Calculates the sum per group.
Variance: Calculates the variance per group.
All aggregation methods ignore missing values.
fullDescription.option: The aggregation method to use for none numerical columns. The following methods can be applied: First, Last, Mode, Count
The aggregation method to use for numerical columns. The following methods can be applied: Minimum, Maximum, Mean, Sum, Variance, First, Last, Mode, Count

Defines the maximum number of unique values per group to avoid memory exceptions. This option is only enabled if a memory consuming method like Mode is selected. All groups with more unique values are skipped during calculation and the result is a missing value.
Moves the selected group column(s) to the front of the result table.
Performs the necessary sorting in the memory. Speeds up the process but consumes much more memory.
If enabled the hiliting of a group row will hilite all rows of this group in other views. Builds a map with the group row keys and the related input table row keys.
Select one or more column(s) to perform a grouping on.

ports.dataIn: Input table with at least two columns to perform the grouping.
ports.dataOut: Result table with a row per unique group column value pair.
